item.title: Hey There! Two Thousand Seventeen
item.description:
2017 is here and lots of great things are about to happen this year in my life and in the world. I will be shifting to a new place, I will turn 24, I will be completing 2 years of my professional career and much more.

2016 was a great year for me it raised the bars high for 2017 and I am hoping this will be the trend for the years to come.

This year my main focus will be to an amazing programmer, I still am a decent programmer and I tried different learning techniques and methods in 2016, this year I am hoping to take it off the charts, I am yet to create list of actionable items that will take me to the fulfillment of this goal. Another thing that has caught my interest in 2016 was reading books, I can’t express in words what benefits I have gained from reading books. My area of interest in book reading will be more in philosophy and economics and fiction while I am traveling or when I want to sleep better.

Also here are few objectives that I will achieve in 2017 and this list will expand for at least 3 months (order is irrelevant)-

1. Weekend Fasting -

One of the few things that changed my life in 2016 was becoming fit and active, I think I was in my fittest version in 2016. This year I want to take it to a next level and start implementing no carbs weekend, I am hoping to start this small like 1 weekend in one month, then twice and so on. Benefits of this -

  • Internal Cleansing of body
  • During weekends I generally stay at home doing my things, which sometimes leads to the unwanted stuffing of calories, this discipline will put a check on it.
  • Will compliment in my adverse time.(You don’t need unhealthy food to rejuvenate or uplift your mood)
  • Will make me more tolerant to pain and hunger.

2. Cross Borders of India -

Ah!! 2016 was full of traveling Leh, Kerala, so many treks and I really enjoyed all of the trips. My bonding with friends, family and myself increased after these trips and I have so many happy memories to cherish. I want to take this traveling spirit at a next step and put my foot out of India. It’s not like I hate India, I love it but taking an international trip was on my checklist for a long time and I intend to check it off this year. Following are the destinations in my head, please suggest more in comments * Dubai * Hong Kong * Jordan * Thailand or Bangkok :p * Maybe some parts of Europe.

3. A Month Without Whatsapp & Leaving all the Groups -

I don’t hate WhatsApp, it’s an awesome feat of engineering, but sometimes it makes me wonder how much time I and people surrounding me waste on WhatsApp. I ditched facebook in 2016 and my life is pretty much unaffected I am hoping WhatsApp is overrated too and I can easily get rid of it. It just surrounding pressure that forces you to use Whatsapp, I am not able to get rid of the WhatsApp now because I live in a no network zone and WhatsApp is an alternative for calling and communicating. Once I move out of this zone I will definitely ditch Whatsapp.

4. Active blogging -

I was always bad at communicating my ideas to the world because I feel that my linguistic part of the brain is weak and I need to make it stronger. Active blogging will allow me to force my ideas and thoughts out of my head and put it in words. What I am planning to do is put out at least two blogs per week (long or short doesn’t matter) and during my free space of time, I will keep thinking of a good idea or topic for the blog which I will note it down. Blogging so far feels great it’s like open sourcing your thoughts to the world, at this point in time, I know that very few people read my blogs and I will try to increase my audience too.

5. Progressive Web App of My Website -

I put out jitenagarwal.com during fall of 2016, and it started with the idea of getting a better job and as a medium to showcase my work, but now I don’t want to stop here. More I think about how I can use my website more Ideas pop in my mind and more effort that will require. Right now this website is just static(which was a good start). But I am hoping to move out of that and make it like an application and implement following things -

  • Photo sharing Page(Instagram is for Millennials and Muggles)
  • Track my habits and create charts of trends using D3.js (see point 7)
  • Logging the places(restaurants, hotels any other tourist site) I have been
  • Sharing technical and project experience.
  • Sharing all other stuff (books, podcasts, movies, things that I have bought)

6. Scheduling -

I took good control of my time in 2016 as compared to my previous years but when I listen to awesome people on the planet talking about how much valuable time is and it makes me feel like a jerk, throwing my time here and there. Basically, I am planning, Scheduling on Weekly and Monthly basis which will allow me to manage my time resource wisely.

7. Logging Everything and Taking Notes -

When you workout intensely you understand the power of logs. Without logging your workout, everything goes for a toss and you cannot track your progress and areas of improvement. And things which cannot be measured cannot be improved. So, I thought why not apply the logging framework for everything in my life I am working on creating an application for it and I will track following things on it - * Workout logs (obviously) * Programming languages I worked on every day * My Diet habits(avoiding sugar, fried and other Junk) * Reading Habit * And Other habits

8. Stop giving Free Advice -

I gave lots of free advice to people in 2016 only with good intentions and to help them in any way I can. But giving free advice kind of sets a tiny bit of expectations in my head of them following my advice and you know how dangerous is expecting from other people(MOSTLY DISAPPOINTMENT). So to save myself from Disappointment I will just put out my thoughts and help on my blog and will stop giving free advice unless anyone asks for it. Quote from Joker comes to my mind which fits perfectly here - IF YOU ARE GOOD AT SOMETHING NEVER DO IT FOR FREE.

9. 5 Minutes gratitude journal -

I explored a lot of ways of journaling which will fit my lifestyle and I have finally settled on this technique.

10. Follow Stoicism Religiously -

If you dont know what Stoicism here is Wiki. I have come to understanding that life is going to be tough & painful. Subsidising these painful moments and hardships by partying and doing other muggle thing is really not my style. I was looking for a certain philosophy to deal with pain and hardships which lead me to Stoicism. I am currently reading all the literature and books around Stoicism to figure out how to adopt a Stoic Life.

This is not my exhaustive list of resolutions but I will keep updating also I am asking my friends and family about one resolution that they would like to add on my list, which will make me reflect more on myself.

If you have any thoughts and comments to share please share them I would love to listen.

I HOPE YOU TOO HAVE AN AMAZING 2017.

PEACE.

item.title: Best Gift Parents can Give to their Children
item.description:
Disclaimer - I am no parenting expert, just putting out my thoughts.

Parenting is hard and for majority of parents it is their first time. So we all know what it is like to do a difficult task with inexperience. Apart from cleaning shit and pee stuff, the part where it really gets difficult is when you are supposed to impart your values to your offspring.

I think when you have kids you get some kind of “Power” you get. Power of releasing a product in the society who might become president or a criminal one day. So with great power comes great responsiblity.

I was lucky to have great parents. Now that I am an adult and kind of on my own when I looked back I realized what were the key great things that every parent should consider. While I am not saying I am very successful individual but I think my parents were very successful parents.

I know there might be great researches out there which might make this post obvious and noob, these are my thoughts and what I learned from my parents. I want to point out some great parenting style that my parents adopted:

  1. Creating an Environment of Free Will- What I mean by that is as a kid we barely make decisions, partly because we are too naive at that time and also our parents are sometimes too protective but I think allowing me to make many crucial decisions of my life with their support was the best thing my parents did to me. It has made me more responsible and less-blaming-others human being which I think is great skill to have.
  2. Encouraging Honesty - I know it is difficult to explain to a 10-year old what is honesty. But I think the reason kids lie most is because parents scare the shit out of them for small mistakes, which causes the child to lie. I think instead of scolding a child about his/her mistakes parents should try to make sure that he/she admits mistake and learns from them.
  3. Not Comparing with Sharmaji’s Child - I hate when any parent compares his/her child with other child(ren). I just don’t understand how comparing will ever help in your child’s development. Please provide some actionable and constructive feedback if you want your child’s development and understand that every child is unique(Yes for the millionth time!).
  4. Not Putting in Hostel before Secondary Education - I can’t thank my parents enough for letting me stay with them till my 10th(After that I had no choice) despite living in a village. How will you ever impart your knowledge and values if you put your son/daughter in a hostel at such an early stage? Its like putting a kid in a factory(Sorry but True). You have kids because you want to leave a legacy behind you and putting them in hostels never help.
  5. Believing and Trusting Kids - I think parents should be confident that thier offsprings are capable of doing things own their own and not worrying & being paranoid about them all the time.It is very important for a healthy parent-child relationship.
  6. Spending Time With Kids - I was lucky to born in prosperous business family. And we always had time for vacations and daily-fun-family-time(like playing sports, watching movies together etc etc). I have good amount of fun memories with my parents which I am really happy about and would cherish them lifelong.
  7. Freedom to Try - My parents bought Computer when I was 10 year old doofus and having computer at that time was kind of a big thing. It is safe to say I was introduced with love of my life. But at the same time I attended karate classes, music classes and many other classes, Eventually ended up with marrying computers.

I am sure there are many other great things that my parents did which made me a better person and I will surely update them if I could recall them, please share your thoughts and views on the same.

Till then Peace

item.title: Terminal
item.description:
Disclaimer-This post is not for windows user

Unlocking Potential of Terminal One Command at a Time.

I am not a pro user of terminal, but recently I started working on technologies which forced me to use CLI(Command Line Interface) for tasks like building source, running server, deploying the code etc. Generally when you use GUI while you figure out a workflow which is most optimized for you this might include knowing all the keyboard shortcuts, optimizing the Editor’s layout according to you, creating shortcuts on your Desktop and many more which I cannot think of right now. But when you are working on terminal your choices are limited by how you use commands provided and remembering them is a daunting task. As a programmer I feel the power of making my computer work the way I want, so I had to figure out a way to make Terminal work for me to make my workflow optimized.

Aliasing

Word Alias has many meanings if you will google it but the one that suits here is an alternate name for someone or something. In terminal also we can pretty much alias anything we want, meaning we can rename any complicated command in our own way.

How this is helpful?-You may ask Let me show you how -

Let’s say everytime I want to work on my personal website I have to write following commands in the terminal -

  • $cd ~/Documents/myProjects/myWebsite to change my working directory
  • $code . - To open VS Code (Editor)
  • $hugo serve - To start my local server

After Aliasing I just write $mySite_run. This single commands executes all three commands.

Enough jibber-jabber show me how to do it Look for ~/.bash_profile, ~/.bash_login or ~/.profile which are files which are executed whenever you open the terminal, we will add our alias command here so that we can use them whenever terminal starts. If you weren’t able to find any of the aboove mentioned files type touch ~/.bash_profile to create new file. Once the file is created you can open it any editor of your choice and start editing it. For the example that I gave above alias command will look like this

alias mySite_run='cd ~/Documents/mySite/; code .;hugo server'

; in command helps to execute more than one commands in one go.

Other alias that I use are following - - alias poweroff='sudo /sbin/shutdown -h now' - for force mac shutdown - alias mysql='/usr/local/mysql-5.5.25-osx10.6-x86_64/bin/mysql -u root' - to start mysql installation

You can add as many aliases you want and optimize your daily workflow.

One quick pro tip

If you are like me and keep forgetting stuff I like to print my alias whenever I open my terminal using echo so lets I write

echo -e 'Use\nmySite_run-to edit website\namazon_project-to edit amazon_project'

which will give me output like this whenever I open the terminal which helps me keep track of my aliases

Go Ahead Geek Out

Let me know if you have more cool terminal tricks

item.title: Million Words Social Network built using Ionic Framework
item.description:
I was looking forward to learn more javascript frameworks after getting a glimpse of React-Native and basic understanding of javascript this time my focus was to learn a framwork that will help me in learning web-development too, So I came across AngularJs. After learning and understanding basics of AngularJs I was thinking of a cool project that I can do to make my understanding more robust. I thought of creating a simple Social Network type application which I could implement in AngularJs. I decided to go mobile again and was looking for a framework which was using AngularJs at its core to build a Hybrid Mobile Appilication. After searching a bit I came across Ionic Framework.

Ionic Framework

Ionic is the open source mobile sdk that will allow you to build Progressive Web and Native Apps easily.

Features Of Ionic Framework -

  1. Integeration with cordova.
  2. Uses AngularJs
  3. Provides extensive set of components like list, buttons, label, header, footer, tab-navigation etc.
  4. Good Command Line Interface for debugging and building application(I used iOS and android)
  5. Supports SaSS and Less for themeing

The App - Million Words.

I like the concept of Sex of Ideas here’s the ted talk where in you take mate two ideas and derive a new idea out of it. So here the Million Words app was the child of Quora(where you ask questions) and Instagram(where you post pictures with some description). Yes, you guessed it right in Million Words you can ask questions that can be only answered using pictures and short description. And the name million words because A picture is worth million words Following were the features I implemented in the first version of Million words.

  1. Multi User
    • login
    • signup
    • User can add profile pictures and update their info(name, email, short description)
    • Other users can view profiles(Info, question, answers) of the users.
  2. Ask Question
    • A user can ask question.
    • Upvote and downvote a question.
    • Separate Screen for unanswered questions.
  3. Answer to a Question
    • User can answer the question by uploading a picture(from gallery or camera) along with short description.
    • User can comment on any answer
    • User can like the answer.
    • User can view other user’s answer

Libraries and Technologies Used -

  1. Ionic Framework v1 - To build the app.
  2. Cordova Library - Bridge between the native and Web comes with basic native functionality like logging, toast etc. I added Dialog and Camera plugin too.
  3. Grunt - To build and run tasks
  4. NPM - To add and update ionic and cordova plugins.
  5. Bower - To add libraries for the app like moments, firebase etc.
  6. Firebase - Google’s Awesome Realtime database which was backend of my application. I used Authentication and Database of the Firebase more about firebase here – –
  7. Git - I learned git a lot in this project becuase I made myself use branching for a feature. So it was fun.
  8. Geny Motion - Best Android Emulator I came across. I am mentioning this because it was a big relief for me when I came across Geny Motion, it’s fast and simple to use.

There are many other things I need to implement in this app, I will make it more polished in the future if anyone likes the idea and is willing to contribute please let me know. I haven’t made it open source yet.

item.title: React Native App To Manage Expense
item.description:
Framework React-Native

I created this app when I started learning Javascript and explored different frameworks in Javascript, then I bumped into react-native and was really amazed by facebook’s approach of creating HYBRID Mobile App. React-Native is build around the philosophy that learn once and write everywhere over write once and run everywhere(philosophy of phonegap).

You might have to write more uncommon code for Android and iOS in React-Native but you will be writing in same language(i.e. JS) and everything will be rendered natively when you will run the app. I was at that time working on an Android Application and thought of writing a simple app on this platform.

Some useful resources

  • You can also get started on react-native by following this.
  • Amazing list of react-native plugins here.
  • For layouts react-native heavily uses flexbox, handy reference here.

App Money Management

Github Link
So the reasons why I built this app are -

  1. I wanted to learn react-native
  2. I wanted to build a simple app to track my expenses.

I felt the need to create my own expense management app because all the expense management apps out there are complex and do many things, which i didnt want. So I figured out building a very simple app that will do the job. So my basic requirements were very simple -

  1. Should have some fields to enter my expenses - (Name of expense, expense, and some description)
  2. Should have categories to store my expenses(Food, Travel, Shopping, Home and Other)
  3. Way to view the expenses on the basis of categories and time(monthly or yearly)
  4. Store the expenses locally.

Further Improvements that I will implement in the future -

  1. Adding OCR to scan bill images directly in the app.
  2. Storing data in the cloud (like firebase)
  3. Implementing User login and rollout public version of the app.
